```{r}
colnames(Benning_TenYear)[10]="WBGT"
#take just the maximum WBGTC reading for each day
Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High <- Benning_TenYear%>%
  filter(!is.na(Day), !is.na(WBGT)) %>%
  group_by(Year, Month, Day)%>%
  summarise(WBGT.Max = max(WBGT))%>%
  mutate(WBGT.Max.C = (WBGT.Max - 32) * (5/9))

view(Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High)
#Jackson_TenYear.Daily.WBGTC.High.Plot <- ggplot(Jackson_TenYear.Daily.WBGTC.High, aes(x=DAY, y=WBGTC.Max))+geom_point(pch=".")
#Jackson_TenYear.Daily.WBGTC.High.Plot #no good - plots the range over each day (31 points along X Axis)
```
```{r}
#Fixing dates
create.date <- make_date(year=Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High$Year, month=Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High$Month, day=Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High$Day)

Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High$create.date <- create.date #adds the new date
colnames(Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High)[6]="Daily_Date" #renames the column to something more appropriate
view(Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High)

Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High.Plot <- ggplot(Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High, aes(x=Daily_Date, y=WBGT.Max.C))+geom_point(size=0.5)
Benning_TenYear.Daily.WBGT.High.Plot
```
